first_reading.text:
[[Dn 7,9]]As I watched : Thrones were set up and the Ancient One took his throne. His clothing was bright as snow, and the hair on his head as white as wool ; His throne was flames of fire, with wheels of burning fire.
[[Dn 7,10]]A surging stream of fire flowed out from where he sat; Thousands upon thousands were ministering to him, and myriads upon myriads attended him. The court was convened, and the books were opened.
[[Dn 7,13]]As the visions during the night continued, I saw One like a son of man coming, on the clouds of heaven; When he reached the Ancient One and was presented before him,
[[Dn 7,14]]He received dominion, glory, and kingship; nations and peoples of every language serve him. His dominion is an everlasting dominion that shall not be taken away, his kingship shall not be destroyed.
first_reading.title: Book of Daniel

gospel.text:
[[Mt 17,1]]Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother,  and led them up a high mountain by themselves.
[[Mt 17,2]]And he was transfigured before them; his face shone like the sun and his clothes became white as light.
[[Mt 17,3]]And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, conversing with him.
[[Mt 17,4]]Then Peter said to Jesus in reply, "Lord, it is good that we are here. If you wish, I will make three tents here, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
[[Mt 17,5]]While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud cast a shadow over them, then from the cloud came a voice that said, "This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased; listen to him."
[[Mt 17,6]]When the disciples heard this, they fell prostrate and were very much afraid.
[[Mt 17,7]]But Jesus came and touched them, saying, "Rise, and do not be afraid."
[[Mt 17,8]]And when the disciples raised their eyes, they saw no one else but Jesus alone.
[[Mt 17,9]]As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, "Do not tell the vision to anyone until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

second_reading.text:
[[2_P 1,16]]Beloved: We did not follow cleverly devised myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we had been eyewitnesses of his majesty.
[[2_P 1,17]]For he received honor and glory from God the Father when that unique declaration came to him from the majestic glory, "This is my Son, my beloved, with whom I am well pleased."
[[2_P 1,18]]We ourselves heard this voice come from heaven while we were with him on the holy mountain.
[[2_P 1,19]]Moreover, we possess the prophetic message that is altogether reliable. You will do well to be attentive to it, as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts.
second_reading.title: second Letter of Peter

psalm.text:
[[Ps 97,1]]The LORD is king; let the earth rejoice; 
let the many islands be glad.
[[Ps 97,2]]Clouds and darkness are round about him, 
justice and judgment are the foundation of his throne.

[[Ps 97,5]]The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, 
before the Lord of all the earth.
[[Ps 97,6]]The heavens proclaim his justice, 
and all peoples see his glory.

[[Ps 97,9]]You, O LORD, are the Most High over all the earth, 
exalted far above all gods.
psalm.title: Psalms
